definition: to walk (side part of split character)
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to be at large (of a criminal)
escaped criminal/fugitive from the law (criminal suspect on the run)
to run away/to flee in disarray
to flee abroad/to run away/to desert/outflow
to run away/to go into exile

sentences.english: They managed to escape just before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 就在黎明之前，他們設法逃了出來。

sentences.english: I made off through harterhouse Yard into Long Lane.
sentences.chinese: 我由察忒豪斯圍場逃到長巷。

sentences.english: Bai Chen whether had escaped to assassinate?
The affrighted poultry fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 受驚的家禽向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: The crowd in a panic fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 倉皇的人羣向四面逃去。

sentences.english: WenQing foot want to flee, apple and others together to chase.
sentences.chinese: 溫晴拔足想逃，花蘋等人一同追截。

sentences.english: They must have thought they were going to get in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 她們立馬四散而逃，她們肯定以爲自己闖了什麼大禍。

sentences.english: The flight or fight response includes a rapid heartbeat and dry mouth, trembling hands.
sentences.chinese: 戰或逃的反應包括心跳加速，嘴巴發乾，雙手顫抖。

sentences.english: Some have fled west to Liberia or east to Ghana.
sentences.chinese: 一些人逃到了西部的利比里亞或東部的加納。

sentences.english: She frantically fled down the stairwell.
sentences.chinese: 她瘋狂地沿着樓梯井往下逃。

sentences.english: The spy attempted to escape to a neighbouring country.
sentences.chinese: 那個間諜企圖逃到鄰國去。

sentences.english: We marvel(l)ed that they had escaped unhurt.
sentences.chinese: 我們感到驚奇的是他們竟安然無恙地逃了出來。

sentences.english: Here,  You always know you have an escape,  says Mather.
sentences.chinese: 馬瑟說，在這裏“你總知道自己有路可逃”。

sentences.english: The lad fled on the instant, scrambled up the high board-fence.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆撥腿就逃，頃刻他爬過高高的木柵欄。

sentences.english: The harder you chase them, the faster they run away.
sentences.chinese: 你追得越猛，他們就逃得越快。

definition: to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
to run away/to flee in disarray
to run away/to take to one's heels
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to leave in stealth/to slip away
